algorithm_technique: Stars and Bars with Inclusion-Exclusion Principle
problem_summary_simple: Distribute n candies among 3 children with a limit per child.
problem_summary_technical: Uses combinatorics (Stars and Bars) and Inclusion-Exclusion to count distributions under a limit.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding non-negative integer solutions to x1 + x2 + x3 = n.
The constraint x_i <= limit is handled using the Principle of Inclusion-Exclusion.
The nHr formula (n+r-1 choose r-1) is crucial for combinations with repetition.
